DOC.brief_summary: The primary objective of this study is to measure efficacy of our new protocol by monitoring the results of our routine respiratory cultures at the end of the new standard treatment, and during routine visits for 1 year from initiation of therapy for Staphylococcus aureus. The secondary objective will include determining the clinical course (pulmonary exacerbations, antibiotic use, hospitalizations, pulmonary function tests) of patients who underwent the protocol.
DOC.brief_title: Effect of Topical and Systemic Decolonization of Staphylococcus Aureus (SA) in Pediatric Cystic Fibrosis (CF) Patients
DOC.criteria: Eligible participants will include all patients with CF who test positive for SA from respiratory tract culture (throat, nares or expectorated sputum) and are 223 months of age at protocol presentation. Patients coinfected with other bacteria (e.g. Pseudomonas) or documented to have an allergy or resistance to any of the intervention substances will be excluded.
